definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon

pinyin: A1 bi3 xi1 ni2 ya4 Guan1 hua4

sentences.english: What the reporters got from him was just political doublespeak.
sentences.chinese: 记者从他那里所得到的，无非是官话。

sentences.english: Hany ing accents belonged to south - west standard, with the features of Hunan accents.
sentences.chinese: 汉阴方言属西南官话，具有浓郁湘语特色。

sentences.english: Because of tone change and effect of Ningyuan Guanhua, entering tone continues to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 入声通过连读变调，官话的影响继续演变。

sentences.english: The research object herein is Langfang-Jilu Mandarin district dialects.
sentences.chinese: 本文的研究对象是廊坊冀鲁官话区方言。

sentences.english: Kriya: Could you please specify what language you would prefer: Cantonese, or Mandarin?
sentences.chinese: 你需要官话就是普通话还是广东话的打给你？

sentences.english: Modern Sichuan dialect belongs to the division of southwest official language Chinese northern dialects.
sentences.chinese: 今天的四川方言属于北方方言西南官话区。

sentences.english: They always use the Chengdu Mandarin in Formal occasions.
sentences.chinese: 在去政府办事等正式社交场合中，一般使用成都官话。

sentences.english: Laiwu lies in the middle part of Shandong Province, Laiwu dialect belongs to Jilu Manadarin.
sentences.chinese: 莱芜位于山东中部，莱芜方言属于冀鲁官话。

sentences.english: Huaiyuan dialect is subordinate to Jianghuai mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 安徽怀远方言属江淮官话。

sentences.english: Xuanwu dialect belongs to the East Henan Section of Central Plains Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 玄武方言属于中原官话的豫东片。

sentences.english: The extinction and evolution of rushing tone in mandarin district is a very complex issue.
sentences.chinese: 入声在官话区的消失和演变是一个很复杂的问题。

definition: Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
Wu dialects (spoken primarily in Shanghai and surrounding areas)
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to speak with a foreign accent or using words from a foreign language (usually derogatory) (idiom)
